sep.gaia.resources.weather

Class WeatherResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.DataResource
      • sep.gaia.resources.weather.WeatherResource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WeatherResource
extends DataResource
    Concrete class WeatherResource inherits from DataResource. It contains everything that is necessary to create a graphical weather status in the view with an icon that represents the current weather (e.g. a shining sun symbol for a warm and nice weather). A WeatherResource dummy contains only its geographical position with longitude and latitude coordinates. The specific weather data, such as temperature, weather code can be set by the Loader class. The valid flag inheritated by the parent DataResource class indicates, whether the WeatherResource contains all weather information in it. The weather information is taken of openweathermap.org api. Theoretically its api-independent instead of the weatherConditionCode member, which is a openweathermap.org specific value. Each WeatherResource represents one geographical location in the world. As float variables for its location makes it hard to compare two such locations because of rounding issues, each WeatherResource object is identified by its associated tile number at constant zoom level (key).
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer
    See Also:
    WeatherData , Serialized Form

      • WeatherResource

        public WeatherResource(float lat,
               float lon,
               int tileZoom)
        The constructor creates a dummy object. Dummy object means, this WeatherResource has specific geographical coordinates, but contains not any weather information yet.
        Parameters:
        lat - The geographical, latitude coordinate.
        lon - The geographical, longitude coordinate.

        public java.awt.Image getIcon()

      • getTemperature

        public float getTemperature()
        Returns the current temperature in degree Celsius for the place, where this WeatherResource points at.
        Returns:
        The current temperature in degree Celsius for the places specified by longitude and latitude coordinates.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        The coordinates are to specify the exact position of the object. However a name can be set to have a human-friendly identifier. This name is also shown in the View.
        Returns:
        The Name of the location (e.g. city) of this WeatherResource object.

      • getWeatherConditionCode

        public int getWeatherConditionCode()
        The Weather Condition Code specifies the current "state" of the weather. E.g. "801" stands for "few clouds". Each Weather Condition Code has a separate graphical icon, which can be referred by the Weather Condition Code.
        Returns:
        The Weather Condition Code.
        See Also:
        Weather Condition Code.

      • getTexture

        public com.jogamp.opengl.util.texture.TextureData getTexture()
        Create a drawable "image" of this WeatherResource object. This "image" contains all information needed and available, such as temperature, weather-icon and the name of the location.
        Returns:
        A TextureData object which can be bound and drawn immediately by OpenGL.
        See Also:
        TextureData
